entries.title: Aid Groups Pause Work in Afghanistan After Taliban Move
entries.description: Taliban leadership said women would no longer be allowed to work for nongovernmental organizations.

entries.title: Zelensky Urges Ukrainians to Persevere as Putin Says Moscow Ready for Long War
entries.description: Air-raid sirens sounded across Ukraine hours after President Volodymyr Zelensky made a defiant Christmas video address urging Ukrainians to stand firm and keep faith in an eventual victory over Russian forces.

entries.title: U.S. Steps Up Raids Against Islamic State in Syria
entries.description: Nearly a dozen risky helicopter operations kill or capture top militant operatives.

entries.title: Paris Kurdish Center Attacker Aimed to Kill Non-Europeans, Police Say
entries.description: Prosecutors say they have found no links between extreme-right groups and the suspect in the attack, who has been transferred to a police psychiatric unit.

entries.title: China Stops Issuing Daily Covid Data Ahead of Outbreak's Peak
entries.description: Authorities in some regions estimate up to a million residents are being infected each day.

entries.title: This Christmas, Many Christians in Ukraine Turn Away From Russia
entries.description: In Ukraine, many Christians are celebrating Christmas on Dec. 25 this year, instead of in January, as they repudiate the Moscow-affiliated Orthodox church.
